body.p: “…A quarter of a mile down-stream it occurred again “,” thus: [image] and near by still less of a track “,” but marks as if it had pecked in the snow. Could it be the track of a crow with its toes unusually close together? Or was it an owl? Some creature has been eating elm blossom-buds and dropping them over the snow.”
PE 10, pg. 156 / 4 January-23 April 1856 / NNPM MA 1302:26 / T vol. # XX / PDF # XIV / JVIII
